DataElement.preferredName: Cutaneous Melanoma American Joint Committee on Cancer (AJCC) Edition 7 Pathologic Distant Metastasis M Stage
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Extent of the distant metastasis for melanoma of the skin based on evidence obtained from pathologic examination through completion of definitive surgery.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A primary melanoma arising from atypical melanocytes in the skin. Precursor lesions include acquired and congenital melanocytic nevi, and dysplastic nevi. Several histologic variants have been recognized, including superficial spreading melanoma, acral lentiginous melanoma, nodular melanoma, and lentigo maligna melanoma._Caused by or altered by or manifesting disease or pathology._One criteria of the TMN staging system.  M refers to the presence of metastasis.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A malignant neoplasm derived from cells that are capable of forming melanin.

Concepts.definition: A primary melanoma arising from atypical melanocytes in the skin.  Precursor lesions include acquired and congenital melanocytic nevi, and dysplastic nevi.  Several histologic variants have been recognized, including superficial spreading melanoma, acral lentiginous melanoma, nodular melanoma, and lentigo maligna melanoma.

Property.preferredDefinition: Pathologic; caused by or altered by or manifesting disease or pathology.:One criteria of the TMN staging system.  M refers to the presence of metastasis.

Concepts.definition: Caused by or altered by or manifesting disease or pathology.
One criteria of the TNM staging system. M refers to the presence of metastasis.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

DataElementConcept.origin: AJCC Based:Staging Criteria Based on American Joint Committee on Cancer System
DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 4/9/18 tt moved to NCI Standards Context. Created for CRF standard harmonization. Released per final community approval. mc 5/7/12

ValueDomain.preferredName: Cutaneous Melanoma American Joint Committee on Cancer (AJCC) Edition 7 Pathologic M Stage
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A finding about one or more characteristics of cutaneous melanoma, following the rules of the TNM AJCC v7 classification system.  The TNM clinical and pathologic regional lymph nodes tumor classifications of cutaneous melanoma are not the same. (from AJCC 7th Ed.)_A group formed for the purpose of developing a system of clinical staging for cancer that is acceptable to the American medical profession and is compatible with other accepted classifications._Caused by or altered by or manifesting disease or pathology._One criteria of the TMN staging system.  M refers to the presence of metastasis._The extent of a cancer within the body, especially whether the disease has spread from the original site to other parts of the body.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Cutaneous Melanoma pM1a TNM Finding v7

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Cutaneous Melanoma pM1a TNM Finding v7
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Cutaneous melanoma with metastases to skin, subcutaneous tissues, or distant lymph nodes associated with normal serum lactate dehydrogenase (LDH). (from AJCC 7th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Cutaneous Melanoma pM1a TNM Finding v7
Concepts.definition: Cutaneous melanoma with metastases to skin, subcutaneous tissues, or distant lymph nodes associated with normal serum lactate dehydrogenase (LDH). (from AJCC 7th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Cutaneous Melanoma pM1b TNM Finding v7

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Cutaneous Melanoma pM1b TNM Finding v7
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Cutaneous melanoma with metastases to lung associated with normal serum lactate dehydrogenase (LDH). (from AJCC 7th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Cutaneous Melanoma pM1b TNM Finding v7
Concepts.definition: Cutaneous melanoma with metastases to lung associated with normal serum lactate dehydrogenase (LDH). (from AJCC 7th Ed.)

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Cutaneous melanoma with metastases to all other visceral sites associated with normal serum lactate dehydrogenase (LDH) or distant metastases to any site associated with an elevated serum LDH. (from AJCC 6th and 7th Eds.)

Concepts.definition: Cutaneous melanoma with metastases to all other visceral sites associated with normal serum lactate dehydrogenase (LDH) or distant metastases to any site associated with an elevated serum LDH. (from AJCC 6th and 7th Eds.)

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

A group formed for the purpose of developing a system of clinical staging for cancer that is acceptable to the American medical profession and is compatible with other accepted classifications.

One criteria of the TNM staging system. M refers to the presence of metastasis.
The extent of a cancer in the body.
